Posts.Content: Laura... I have been on arimedex for almost three years...still have "heavy" hot flashes 10-12 times a day and 4-5 at night..but my main complaint is joint pain in knees mostly.  Had minor knee surgery and new injection (Synvic) but still have discomfort, tho is much better.  I am interested in the long term effects of this drug.  If anyone knows please contact me.  I take effexor for hot flashes but not sure it helps, but if I don't eat chocolate and watch caffeine and spicy dishes (everything I love) I guess it's not too bad..( My husband says I need a new thermostat)  I'm just concerned about long term effects of arimedex.

Posts.Content: On 7/19/2007 CindyS wrote: I'm with the lady that hates the arimedex.  I took it for a year and didn't seem to have any trouble until the vision fogged up in my left eye and then about six months after that my shoulder went weak and achy, that no sooner went away and my hip started giving so much pain that for awhile I could barely get out of bed.  Six months ago I quit taking it and my vision is clear some of the time and I'm still waiting for the hip to feel like it use to.  How bad do we need this stuff.  Cindy I do not know ...but all my joints give me alot of pain..had a knee operation..not much help..hand & fingers are stiff in morning..i will see doctor next week ..hard to go up stairs...had therapy to strengthen muscles but not much help either...should be on it for five years but what are long term effects ?..will let you know....blonde...
